title: Haleakalā National Park: Get Involved
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved           Get Involved       Looking for how to get involved? Her are some ways to find opportunities to get involved here at Haleakalā National Park. Haleakalā National Park Centennial - Haleakalā National Park is celebrating its centennial on August 1, 2016. NPS Centennial - The National Park Service is turning 100 years old on August 25, 2016. Volunteer with us! Meet our Volunteers! Doing business with the park. The internship program, which was a four-year pilot program, will be on hiatus in 2016. We will offer internships again in 2017 after a new coordinator is hired. Thank you for your interest and we look forward to seeing your applications in 2017!        Visitors learning to weave coconut leaves as part of the Hana No`eau series NPS  Hana No`eau 2016, A Call for Cultural PractitionersHaleakalā National Park seeks cultural practitioners for Hana No`eau, a series of Native Hawaiian cultural programs. The name refers to honoring and demonstrating Native Hawaiian traditions. The series is open to all practitioners; schools and community youth groups are especially encouraged to apply. Through support from our non-profit partner, the Hawai`i Pacific Parks Association, an honorarium of $200 will be offered to each group of practitioners. The series will begin on Saturday, July 9, and run through Sunday, September 18, 2016.For more information on how to apply, please download an application below.2016 Hana No`eau Application (PDF file)2016 Hana No`eau Application (Word file)
